column4: anyone know how to disable iptables, I just wanna make sure that iptables is infact causing my problem
what does iptables -L give you?
all ACCEPT?
yup all 3 tables
then it likely isn't your problem
you could unload the module if you really wanted to be sure
wanna take a stab at what my problem could be
what is the problem?

fresh install of ubuntu-server, bind9 is setup and works locally, dhcp is setup and works on the the network, the server can ping the other computers on the network but the other computers can't ping it
if it's connection from two machines, ping might sort out if their is connectivity
oh you're on it :) ...roe do you know how to use tcpdump?
if you can use tcpdump on the server machine, you can see what's happening to the packets
I will investigate
AAA ok I have some info... the pinging computer returns destination host unreachable, the tcpdump reports arp who-has <sever-ip> tell <pinging-IP>
so your routing is wrong
how are these computers connected?
yeah what about 'netstat -r'?
ah so it's bind
have you used the bind testing utilities?
but pinging I wasn't using host names... straight IPS
of course, sorry
bind is happy locally everything resolves correctly
